intro: Pseudocymopterus montanus var. purpureus, commonly known as the purple mountain cymopterus, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a soft, hairy coating. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbrella-like clusters, and range in color from white to pale purple. This variant is distinguished by its striking purple hues, which are more pronounced in its flowers and leaves compared to other varieties of the species.
